item.title: Simonsohn (2014)
item.author: elise.gould@unimelb.edu.au (Elise Gould)
item.description: Relationship to frequentist analyses, and the potential for P-hacking Simsonohn (2014) ran two computational experiments looking at the effects of p-hacking practices on the chance of a type I error for both Bayesian confidence intervals and Bayes Factors. He compared the Bayesian methods to the frequentist methods for each. Bayesian confidence intervals are mathematically equivalent to frequentist confidence intervals. The only real difference is that their philosophical interpretation is different (and under both inference frameworks, normality is assumed).
